titleStmt.title: John G. Lennon to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2176

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: Peition of the uncersigned a Resident Citizen of the City of Louisvlle County of Jefferson State of Ky I have the honor to respectfully solicit the appointment of Notary Public for the County of Jefferson and as a stranger to your Excellency submit the following testimonial of qualification for the office

Your Obedient Servt
John G. Lennon

The undersigned residents of the City of Louisville Ky recommend to the consideration of his excellency Governor Bramlette of the State of Ky the above applicant John G. Lennon as duley afit and proper person for the appointment of Notary Public for the county of Jefferson, a Gentleman and duley qualified and of honorable antecedent, to guarantee a faithful discharge of the duties apertaining thereto

E. J. Vaughan
Jas. P. Flint
James P. Sharp

Notary Public
Jefferson Co
John G. Lennon
apptd
13 Sept 1865
